com.oracle.javafx.scenebuilder.kit.editor

Class EditorController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.oracle.javafx.scenebuilder.kit.editor.EditorController

  • public class EditorController
extends java.lang.Object
    An editor controller is the central object which coordinates the editing of an FXML document across the different panels (hierarchy, content, inspector...).

    An editor controller is associated to an FXML document. It can perform editing and control actions on this document. It also maintains the list of objects selected by the user.

    Some panel controllers can be attached to an editor controller. They listen to the editor and update their content accordingly.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  EditorController.ControlAction
      A 'control' action does not modify the document.
      static class  EditorController.EditAction
      An 'edit' action is an action which modifies the document associated to this editor.
      static class  EditorController.Size
      Predefined sizes (width x height).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EditorController()
      Creates an empty editor controller (ie it has no associated fxom document).

      • setFxmlText

        public void setFxmlText(java.lang.String fxmlText)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the fxml content to be edited by this editor. A null value makes this editor empty.
        Parameters:
        fxmlText - null or the fxml text to be edited
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if fxml text cannot be parsed and loaded correctly.

      • getFxmlText

        public java.lang.String getFxmlText()
        Returns null or the fxml content being edited by this editor.
        Returns:
        null or the fxml content being edited by this editor.

      • canGetFxmlText

        public boolean canGetFxmlText()
        Returns true if fxml content being edited can be returned safely. This method will return false if there is a text editing session on-going.
        Returns:
        true if fxml content being edited can be returned safely.

      • textEditingSessionDidBegin

        public void textEditingSessionDidBegin(javafx.util.Callback<java.lang.Void,java.lang.Boolean> requestSessionEnd)
        Tells this editor that a text editing session has started. The editor controller may invoke the requestSessionEnd() callback if it needs the text editing session to stop. The callback should; - either stop the text editing session, invoke textEditingSessionDidEnd() and return true - either keep the text editing session on-going and return false
        Parameters:
        requestSessionEnd - Callback that should end the text editing session or return false

      • textEditingSessionDidEnd

        public void textEditingSessionDidEnd()
        Tells this editor that the text editing session has ended.

      • setFxmlLocation

        public void setFxmlLocation(java.net.URL fxmlLocation)
        Sets the location of the fxml being edited. If null value is passed, fxml text is being interpreted with any location (ie some references may be broken).
        Parameters:
        fxmlLocation - null or the location of the fxml being edited.

      • getLibrary

        public Library getLibrary()
        Returns the library used by this editor.
        Returns:
        the library used by this editor (never null).

      • setLibrary

        public void setLibrary(Library library)
        Sets the library used by this editor. When this method is called, user scene graph is fully rebuilt using the new library and all panel refresh their contents.
        Parameters:
        library - the library to be used by this editor (never null).

      • setFxmlTextAndLocation

        public void setFxmlTextAndLocation(java.lang.String fxmlText,
                                   java.net.URL fxmlLocation)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Sets both fxml text and location to be edited by this editor. Performs setFxmlText() and setFxmlLocation() but in a optimized manner (it avoids an extra scene graph refresh).
        Parameters:
        fxmlText - null or the fxml text to be edited
        fxmlLocation - null or the location of the fxml text being edited
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if fxml text cannot be parsed and loaded correctly.

      • setFxmlTextLocationAndResources

        public void setFxmlTextLocationAndResources(java.lang.String fxmlText,
                                            java.net.URL fxmlLocation,
                                            java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Sets fxml text, location and resources to be edited by this editor. Performs setFxmlText(), setFxmlLocation() and setResources() but in an optimized manner (it avoids extra scene graph refresh).
        Parameters:
        fxmlText - null or the fxml text to be edited
        fxmlLocation - null or the location of the fxml text being edited
        resources - null or the resource bundle used to load the fxml text
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if fxml text cannot be parsed and loaded correctly.

        public java.lang.String getToolStylesheet()

        Returns:
        the tool stylesheet associated to this editor controller (never null)

        Returns:
        the builtin tool stylesheet.

      • startFileWatching

        public void startFileWatching()
        Starts file watching on this editor. This editor will now monitor the files referenced by the FXML text (like images, medias, stylesheets, included fxmls...) and automatically request attached panels to update themselves.

      • stopFileWatching

        public void stopFileWatching()
        Stops file watching on this editor.

      • isFileWatchingStarted

        public boolean isFileWatchingStarted()

        Returns:
        true if file watching is started on this editor.

        public boolean canPerformControlAction(EditorController.ControlAction controlAction)

        Returns:

      • performImportFxml

        public void performImportFxml(java.io.File fxmlFile)
        Performs the 'import' FXML edit action. This action creates an object matching the root node of the selected FXML file and insert it in the document (either as root if the document is empty or under the selection common ancestor node otherwise).
        Parameters:
        fxmlFile - the FXML file to be imported

      • performImportMedia

        public void performImportMedia(java.io.File mediaFile)
        Performs the 'import' media edit action. This action creates an object matching the type of the selected media file (either ImageView or MediaView) and insert it in the document (either as root if the document is empty or under the selection common ancestor node otherwise).
        Parameters:
        mediaFile - the media file to be imported

      • performIncludeFxml

        public void performIncludeFxml(java.io.File fxmlFile)
        Performs the 'include' FXML edit action. As opposed to the 'import' edit action, the 'include' action does not copy the FXML content but adds an fx:include element to the FXML document.
        Parameters:
        fxmlFile - the FXML file to be included

      • performInsert

        public void performInsert(LibraryItem libraryItem)
        Performs the 'insert' edit action. This action creates an object matching the specified library item and insert it in the document (according the selection state).
        Parameters:
        libraryItem - the library item describing the object to be inserted.

      • canPerformInsert

        public boolean canPerformInsert(LibraryItem libraryItem)
        Returns true if the 'insert' action is permitted with the specified library item.
        Parameters:
        libraryItem - the library item describing the object to be inserted.
        Returns:
        true if the 'insert' action is permitted.

      • performWrap

        public void performWrap(java.lang.Class<? extends javafx.scene.Parent> wrappingClass)
        Performs the 'wrap' edit action. This action creates an object matching the specified class and reparent all the selected objects below this new object.
        Parameters:
        wrappingClass - the wrapping class

      • canPerformWrap

        public boolean canPerformWrap(java.lang.Class<? extends javafx.scene.Parent> wrappingClass)
        Returns true if the 'wrap' action is permitted with the specified class.
        Parameters:
        wrappingClass - the wrapping class.
        Returns:
        true if the 'wrap' action is permitted.

      • getClassesSupportingWrapping

        public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<? extends javafx.scene.Parent>> getClassesSupportingWrapping()
        Return the list of classes that can be passed to performWrap(java.lang.Class).
        Returns:
        the list of classes.

      • getIncludedFile

        public java.io.File getIncludedFile()
        If selection contains single FXOM object and this an fx:include instance, then returns the included file. Else returns null. If the selection is single and is an included FXOM object : 1) if included file source does not start with /, it's a path relative to the document location. - if FXOM document location is null (document not saved yet), return null - else return selection included file 2) if included file source starts with /, it's a path relative to the document class loader. - if FXOM document class loader is null, return null - else return selection included file
        Returns:
        the included file associated to the selected object or null.

      • canPerformSetEffect

        public boolean canPerformSetEffect()
        Returns true if the 'set effect' action is permitted with the current selection. In other words, returns true if the selection contains only Node objects.
        Returns:
        true if the 'set effect' action is permitted.

      • performSetEffect

        public void performSetEffect(java.lang.Class<? extends javafx.scene.effect.Effect> effectClass)
        Performs the 'set effect' edit action. This method creates an instance of the specified effect class and sets it in the effect property of the selected objects.
        Parameters:
        effectClass - class of the effect to be added (never null)

      • canPerformAddContextMenu

        public boolean canPerformAddContextMenu()
        Returns true if the 'add context menu' action is permitted with the current selection. In other words, returns true if the selection contains only Control objects.
        Returns:
        true if the 'add context menu' action is permitted.

      • performAddContextMenu

        public void performAddContextMenu()
        Performs the 'add context menu' edit action. This method creates an instance of ContextMenu and sets it in the contextMenu property of the selected objects.

      • canPerformAddTooltip

        public boolean canPerformAddTooltip()
        Returns true if the 'add tooltip' action is permitted with the current selection. In other words, returns true if the selection contains only Control objects.
        Returns:
        true if the 'add tooltip' action is permitted.

      • performAddTooltip

        public void performAddTooltip()
        Performs the 'add tooltip' edit action. This method creates an instance of Tooltip and sets it in the tooltip property of the selected objects.

        public static java.net.URL getStylesheet()
